page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
The area we are surveying for the l985 Domesday Project, includes the village of Flushing, a small part of Falmouth and Falmouth harbour, and a large part of Carrick Roads (the estuary of the River Fal). The area contains mostly agricultural land with some wooded areas, a village community and a residential area.
We chose to concentrate on the Flushing area because it was within the catchment area of our school and the older children of the village attend the comprehensive school in Penryn.
The village of Flushing was given it's name by Dutch immigrants who settled in this fishing community during the 17th century.
